main event: Multiple unidentified flying object sightings were reported in Thurmon, Colorado in 1952, 1955, and 1955. The sightings involved commercial pilots and ground visual observations of unusual aerial objects.
interesting points: The sightings included observations of a highly classified type of aircraft over the Sangre de Cristo range by an American Air Lines pilot at an altitude over 30,000 feet.
The sighting report of 1955 described an object hovering at 1,500 - 2,000 ft with a size of 40-50 ft in diameter, saucer-like shape, and pulsating, flashing lights around the edge.
The 1952 sighting involved an unidentified aircraft observed by a witness, with no trails or other distinguishing physical characteristics reported.
Immediate identification of the observed objects was not possible due to insufficient data, and no known natural phenomenon explained the sightings.
The reports indicate that under better conditions or with more information, a more definitive conclusion might have been reached.
